albisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base

cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top

cfadDbze94.comment: CFAD (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are frequency distributions of radar  reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) as a function of altitude. The variable cfadDbze94 is defined as the simulated relative frequency of occurrence of radar reflectivity in sampling volumes defined by altitude bins. The radar is observing at a frequency of 94GHz.

cfadLidarsr532.comment: CFAD (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are frequency distributions of radar  reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) as a function of altitude. The variable cfadLidarsr532 is defined as the simulated relative frequency of lidar scattering ratio in sampling volumes defined by altitude bins. The lidar is observing at a wavelength of 532nm.

cfc113global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.
cfc113global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113

cfc11global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
cfc11global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11

cfc12global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
cfc12global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12

ch4.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

ch4global.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
ch4global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell.
ci.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell

clcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

clcalipsoice.comment: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

clcalipsoliq.comment: Percentage liquid water ice cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

cldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
cldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops

cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

clhcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa
clhcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage

climodis.comment: Total ice cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS).

clisccp.comment: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cllcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 840hPa
cllcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clmcalipso.comment: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 560hPa
clmcalipso.long_name: CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Cover Percentage

clmisr.comment: Cloud percentage in spectral bands and layers as observed by the Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) instrument. The first layer in each profile is reserved for a retrieval error flag.
clmisr.long_name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)

clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltcalipso.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltisccp.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

cltmodis.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwmodis.comment: Mass of cloud liquid water, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvi.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvic.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

co2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2mass.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

co2s.comment: As co2, but only at the surface

diabdrag.comment: Other sub-grid scale/numerical zonal drag excluding that already provided for the parameterized orographic and non-orographic gravity waves. This would be used to calculate the total 'diabatic drag'. Contributions to this additional drag such Rayleigh friction and diffusion that can be calculated from the monthly mean wind fields should not be included, but details (e.g. coefficients) of the friction and/or diffusion used in the model should be provided separately.
diabdrag.long_name: Tendency of Eastward Wind from Numerical Artefacts

evspsbl.comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon  that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.
fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

hcfc22global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
hcfc22global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22

hfls.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hursminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum within days time: mean over days
hursminCrop.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
hursminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile

hus19.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus27.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus7h.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

intuadse.comment: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
intuadse.long_name: Vertically Integrated Eastward Dry Statice Energy Transport

intuaw.comment: Vertically integrated Eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

intvadse.comment: Vertically integrated northward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
intvadse.long_name: Vertically Integrated Northward Dry Static Energy Transport

intvaw.comment: Vertically integrated Northward moisture transport (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

jpdftaureicemodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For cloud ice particles.
jpdftaureicemodis.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice

jpdftaureliqmodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For liquid cloud particles.
jpdftaureliqmodis.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid

loaddust.comment: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadso4.comment: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadss.comment: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

lwsrfasdust.comment: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.
lwsrfasdust.long_name: All-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust

lwsrfcsdust.comment: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculating in clear-sky conditions.
lwsrfcsdust.long_name: Clear-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust

lwtoaasdust.comment: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).
lwtoaasdust.long_name: TOA All-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Dust

lwtoacsaer.comment: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).
lwtoacsaer.long_name: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Aerosols

lwtoacsdust.comment: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.
lwtoacsdust.long_name: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Dust

n2o.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

n2oglobal.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

o3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

od443dust.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 443 nanometres.

od550aerso.comment: From tropopause to stratopause as defined by the model
od550aerso.long_name: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (All Aerosols) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)

od550so4so.comment: Stratospheric aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.
od550so4so.long_name: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (Sulphate Only) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)

od865dust.comment: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 865 nanometres.

parasolRefl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

pctisccp.comment: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see  http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html

pr.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

pr17O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr17O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)

pr18O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr18O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

pr2h.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr2h.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)

prCrop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
prCrop.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

prc.comment: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prhmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within hours time: maximum over hours
prhmax.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prra.cell_methods: area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea time: mean
prra.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
prra.long_name: Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea

prsn.comment: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prsn17O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid phase only.
prsn17O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)

prsn18O.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid phase only.
prsn18O.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

prsn2h.comment: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid phase only.
prsn2h.long_name: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

rainmxrat27.long_name: Mass Fraction of Rain in Air

rlds.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlut4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

rlutcs4co2.comment: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rlutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdscsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions
rsdscsdiff.long_name: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation

rsdsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

rss.comment: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

rsus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rsut4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rsutcs4co2.comment: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rsutcs4co2.long_name: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rtmt.comment: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

sconcdust.comment: mass concentration of dust dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sconcso4.comment: mass concentration of sulfate dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.

sconcss.comment: mass concentration of sea-salt dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

sfcWindmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
sfcWindmax.comment: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

snowmxrat27.long_name: Mass Fraction of Snow in Air

swsrfasdust.comment: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.
swsrfasdust.long_name: All-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust

swsrfcsdust.comment: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculated in clear-sky conditions.
swsrfcsdust.long_name: Clear-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust

swtoaasdust.comment: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).
swtoaasdust.long_name: All-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Dust at Toa

swtoacsdust.comment: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).
swtoacsdust.long_name: Clear Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Dust at Toa

tasmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
tasmax.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

tasmaxCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: maximum within days time: mean over days
tasmaxCrop.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')
tasmaxCrop.long_name: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile

tasmin.cell_methods: area: mean time: minimum within days time: mean over days
tasmin.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')

tasminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum within days time: mean over days
tasminCrop.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')
tasminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile

tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

tdps.comment: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

tntmp27.comment: Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
tntmp27.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

ua19.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua27.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua7h.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

uqint.comment: Column integrated eastward wind times specific humidity

utendnogw.comment: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.
utendnogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

utendogw.comment: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.
utendogw.long_name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

va19.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va27.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va7h.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

vqint.comment: Column integrated northward wind times specific humidity

vtendnogw.comment: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)
vtendnogw.long_name: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

vtendogw.comment: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)
vtendogw.long_name: Northward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

wap.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zg27.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
